intro: Pimpinella tragium, commonly known as the lesser cow-weed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in disturbed soils and can often be found in fields and along roadsides. Pimpinella tragium is not typically cultivated for ornamental or culinary purposes but is of interest in ecological studies.
